content: hey DM crafters welcome to the DMS craft I'm DM Scotty good to have you today
we're going to make some mine cars to give flavor to a mine encounter I also I
made a couple cars I made I made a few regular cars and I also made a wrecked
car which is a nice little cover element for your battles and at the end I'm
going to feature some tracks some easy tracks that I made to lay in the mine
also so let's go to the table and I'll show you what I came up with
here I have the pieces of my minecart and I got a bottom and I want to make it
big enough so I could have a couple figures fit in it so I did a little over
two inches and then I did the two sides and the to the front in the back so now
this glue that is on with hot glue why don't we good to go
all right so I have the body of my car done and you can see you can fit the
couple of figures on there now I could have made these walls a little higher
are the sides of the car little higher I didn't want to because I want to I want
to keep you always want to keep playability in mind this is prior a
little bit bigger than an actual car would be but like I say let's keep some
playability in mind and make it so that a couple figures can fit in there so now
I'm going to move on to adding some banding on the the cart
for the top here I'm going to do something a little different than I've
done before I'm just gonna use some matchsticks and I'll just measure up
take my scissors now what I'm going to do is I'm going to take my hot glue gun
and then just this is a thin cardboard so this matchstick is the same width
just so that so that looks pretty nice so what I'll do is I'll do the rest of
these and then we'll come back and do some banding
say hey guys I wanted to show you this before I painted it so here is my mine
car and you can see here I'll grab a couple figures and put them in there so
it's got enough room for two figures so it's a little longer than 2 inches long
and the walls the walls of the car are about 3/4 of an inch tall and then
that's the the height and width of it I did a few details I want to talk about
what was I put some flocking in there too this is a mine car so I thought it'd
be fun to do a little bit of that just didn't fill it up it just put a little
bit and then I also rigged the top of the car to cover the corrugation with
these matchsticks so that was kind of a nice solution I
also used card stock to do banding on the corners and the top there and
that'll be more apparent when I paint it as you can see I used I put some wheels
on by using washers and grab those to show you so here's the here's the size
of the washer depending on what size car you want to do you could use bigger
washers or smaller and then I used tack nails to attach the wheel so I took the
wheel and I put the tack nail through it and then stuck it in glued it in to what
the glue gun glue it into the corrugation of the cardboard on the
bottom part of the of the car here I also use Technion
in the front and back so I thought that'd be kind of fun Sarah nice little
easy to make mining car I also did a little thing here I want to show you I
made one that was damaged and so I had the wheel bench I did I put some banding
on the bottom which I didn't do on the other cars because I was gonna have this
tipped over on the side and then I basically just when I made it
I cut I cut some out from the from the wall or the walls of the cart before I
glued him down so I could simulate that the car had been wrecked so that's a
nice little technique can use that for cover
and just a prop in your in your mind so so there I wanted to show you those
before I painted them up now I'll paint them up and give you a peek at them what
they look like when they have paint on here's the finished minecart and I think
some really nice detail on it as you can see I put some I painted it with the
gunmetal paint to give it that metallic look gives us a nice uniform look I also
painted some streaks on it like it was some rust or some corrosion on the car I
add a little bit of Brown to a tude to give it a rusty color I also added a
little bit of ore in the car I just put some flocking in there not too much but
just to give it a little interesting look inside so that's the the basic car
now I want to show you another one I did that I talked about in the construction
was the damaged car so I'll put that on the table for you now
here's my damaged car and I think it came out quite nice so I did the same
technique I painted it with the gunmetal then added some rust to it and some
streaks I also added some look where like it looks like damage so I kind of
used a little bit of glue gun texture on that to give it some of that look like
it's mashed into something and I'll turn that around you also notice that I put a
base on it so just to keep it sturdy not from falling over and you can see I've
got some rubble inside like the other one and nice little hideout there so you
know a character could hide behind it or enemies could could lurk back here and
shoot at the characters while there they've got hardcover from that cart so
a really nice little detail for a mine that your characters might explore so
there we go and I want to show you one more thing
so hey guys here's some track sections I wanted to show you that I did these look
pretty complicated but they're really easy to make
basically the track itself is jar just matchsticks lined up end to end and I
made sure I ran them parallel the trestles themselves are just broken up
stir stir sticks coffee stir sticks you could also use craft sticks for that I
just put it on a base of thin cardboard I use a little bit of glue gun to give
it a texture and then some flocking on it with the construction sand to give a
little bit of added texture and you can see you can make sections like this or
you could do like broken sections which you could use for difficult terrain or
anything like that I also made it when I created this track section that the car
can sit on the track so it can move actually stay on the track so that's
kind of a cool little feature there too if you want to have that in your in your
mind now the modular this of these tracks makes it great because I can use
these in other mine projects and just you know they're not glued to the tile
so I can just lay it in the tile and there we go I have I have my mind tracks
so there we go the minecart and tracks and I hope you enjoyed this this vid and
I'll see you next time for more dm's craft hey guys if you're really digging
these videos and would like some more information or to talk to other crafters
look at the link below in the description and you can join my forum on
the dams craft we'd love to have you and I'll see you there
you
